newsitem.title: USA: Miss Kansas wins Miss America 1997.
newsitem.headline: Miss Kansas wins Miss America 1997.

text.p: Miss Kansas, Tara Dawn Holland, Saturday won the title of Miss America for 1997.
The 23-year-old music education major won the 76th crown in the competition that began in 1921, beating out the first runner-up, Miss Louisiana, Erika Schwarz.

It was the first contest decided in part by the television audience's call-in vote. The audience vote narrowed the field of 10 semifinalists to five and the winner was selected by a panel of seven celebrity judges.
The new Miss America sang an operatic aria in her talent performance and announced fighting illiteracy was her field of interest.
She was crowned by Miss America of 1996, Shawntel Smith, and won a $40,000 scholarship.
